title.rendered: PERMA-PIPE Awarded A Contract To Supply 5.1 Miles Of Subsea Insulated Pipeline

content.rendered:
For The Dome Patrol Field In The Gulf Of Mexico

PERMA-PIPE has been awarded a contract from LLOG Exploration Offshore to supply 5.1 miles of subsea insulated pipeline for the Dome Patrol Field in the Gulf of Mexico.

The contract scope awarded to PERMA-PIPE covers overseeing engineering support, pipe coating, and supplying FLOW-THERM™ pre-insulated pipe system. The project will utilize FLOW–THERM (formerly Auto-Therm®), a glass syntactic polyurethane (GSPU) that is PERMA-PIPE’s most popular thermal insulation product suitable for temperatures up to 226 °F (108 °C).

FLOW-THERM is high efficient, cost-effective, and with excellent compressive resistance when used on subsea flowlines, risers, field joints, and equipment, including jumpers, pipeline end terminations (PLETs), pipeline end manifolds (PLEMs), and inline structures shrouds, and doghouses for deep and ultra-deepwater requirements.

The project will be executed at our New Iberia, Louisiana facility with the delivery of Q2 2021.

PERMA-PIPE has been a long-term and valued supplier of FLOW-THERM on pre­vious projects with LLOG. We appreciate the opportunity to continue to support and strengthen our relationship with LLOG.
